verses.verse: To the chief <WH5329> Musician, <WH5329> A Psalm <WH4210> for the sons <WH1121> of Korah. <WH7141> Hear <WH8085> this, <WH2063> all <WH3605> you people; <WH5971> give ear, <WH238> all <WH3605> you inhabitants <WH3427> of the world: <WH2465>
Both <WH1571> low <WH120> and high, <WH376> rich <WH6223> and poor, <WH34> together. <WH3162>
My mouth <WH6310> shall speak <WH1696> of wisdom; <WH2454> and the meditation <WH1900> of my heart <WH3820> shall be of understanding. <WH8394>
I will incline <WH5186> my ear <WH241> to a parable: <WH4912> I will open <WH6605> my dark <WH2420> saying <WH2420> on the harp. <WH3658>
Why <WH4100> should I fear <WH3372> in the days <WH3117> of evil, <WH7451> when the iniquity <WH5771> of my heels <WH6120> shall compass <WH5437> me about?
They that trust <WH982> in their wealth, <WH2428> and boast <WH1984> themselves in the multitude <WH7230> of their riches; <WH6239>
None <WH376> <WH3808> of them can by any means redeem <WH6299> his brother, <WH251> nor <WH3808> give <WH5414> to God <WH430> a ransom <WH3724> for him:
(For the redemption <WH6306> of their soul <WH5315> is precious, <WH3365> and it ceases <WH2308> for ever: <WH5769>)
That he should still <WH5750> live <WH2421> for ever, <WH5331> and not see <WH7200> corruption. <WH7845>
For he sees <WH7200> that wise <WH2450> men die, <WH4191> likewise the fool <WH3684> and the brutish <WH1197> person perish, <WH6> and leave <WH5800> their wealth <WH2428> to others. <WH312>

Their inward <WH7130> thought is, that their houses <WH1004> shall continue for ever, <WH5769> and their dwelling <WH4908> places to all generations; <WH1755> they call <WH7121> their lands <WH127> after their own names. <WH8034>
Nevertheless man <WH120> being in honor <WH3366> stays <WH3885> not: he is like <WH4911> the beasts <WH929> that perish. <WH1820>
This <WH2088> their way <WH1870> is their folly: <WH3689> yet their posterity <WH310> approve <WH7521> their sayings. <WH6310> Selah. <WH5542>

Like sheep <WH6629> they are laid <WH8371> in the grave; <WH7585> death <WH4194> shall feed <WH7462> on them; and the upright <WH3477> shall have dominion <WH7287> over them in the morning; <WH1242> and their beauty <WH6736> shall consume <WH1086> in the grave <WH7585> from their dwelling. <WH2073>
But God <WH430> will redeem <WH6299> my soul <WH5315> from the power <WH3027> of the grave: <WH7585> for he shall receive <WH3947> me. Selah. <WH5542>
Be not you afraid <WH3372> when <WH3588> one <WH376> is made rich, <WH6238> when <WH3588> the glory <WH3519> of his house <WH1004> is increased; <WH7235>
For when <WH3588> he dies <WH4194> he shall carry <WH3947> nothing <WH3808> <WH3605> away: his glory <WH3519> shall not descend <WH3381> after <WH310> him.
Though <WH3588> while he lived <WH2416> he blessed <WH1288> his soul: <WH5315> and men will praise <WH3034> you, when <WH3588> you do well <WH3190> to yourself.
He shall go <WH935> to the generation <WH1755> of his fathers; <WH1> they shall never <WH5704> see <WH7200> light. <WH216>
Man <WH120> that is in honor, <WH3366> and understands <WH995> not, is like <WH4911> the beasts <WH929> that perish. <WH1820>
